summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 between federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and a defense attorney, discussing the scheduling of a meeting for the attorney to present a proffer on behalf of their client, Ms. [Redacted], regarding allegations against Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reveal the urgency from prosecutors who believe charges are imminent and detail the high-level officials expected to attend.

persons.name: Ms. [Redacted]
persons.context: The client of attorney M. Prosecutors are seeking her recollection of an incident described in a complaint (specifically page seven) and any observations of Epstein engaged in sexual activity or other women/girls in sexually-suggestive circumstances.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation. Prosecutors reference the client's potential observations of Epstein 'engaged in any sexual activity'.

persons.name: U.S. Attorney
persons.context: One of the high-level 'ultimate decision-makers' in the SDNY expected to attend the proffer meeting scheduled for late January 2020.

persons.name: Deputy U.S. Attorney
persons.context: One of the high-level supervisors in the SDNY expected to attend the proffer meeting.

persons.name: Chief of the Criminal Division
persons.context: One of the high-level supervisors in the SDNY expected to attend the proffer meeting.

persons.name: Chief Counsel
persons.context: One of the SDNY officials expected to attend the proffer meeting.

persons.name: Counsel
persons.context: One of the SDNY officials expected to attend the proffer meeting.

persons.name: Public Corruption Unit chiefs
persons.context: Two unit chiefs from the SDNY's Public Corruption Unit are expected to attend the proffer meeting.

persons.name: FBI investigative and supervisory personnel
persons.context: FBI personnel are expected to be among the 'at least 10 people' attending the proffer meeting from the government side.

connections.description: M. is the attorney representing Ms. [Redacted], coordinating a proffer meeting with prosecutors on her behalf.
Prosecutors are seeking Ms. [Redacted]'s recollection of observing Epstein engaged in sexual activity.
M., as defense counsel, is scheduled to present a proffer to the U.S. Attorney and other senior SDNY officials.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for the defense attorney (M.) to present a proffer to senior SDNY leadership regarding their client's information on Jeffrey Epstein. The meeting is set for 3:30 p.m.

events.title: Internal SDNY Leadership Meeting
events.description: Prosecutors held a meeting with office leadership to discuss the status of the case, concluding that charges were likely and that a proffer meeting with the defense should be arranged.

events.title: Complaint Submission
events.description: A complaint was sent to the defense, which prosecutors reference as containing allegations (specifically on page seven) they wish the client to address.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY) - Referenced as the prosecuting office.
keyFacts: In January 2020, SDNY prosecutors expressed a 'strong view that there are offenses that can be charged now' against Jeffrey Epstein and were moving urgently to schedule a proffer session.

The proffer meeting was to include extremely high-level SDNY officials, including the U.S. Attorney, Deputy U.S. Attorney, Chief of the Criminal Division, and FBI personnel, indicating the case's priority.
Prosecutors specifically sought the client's (Ms. [Redacted]) recollection of an incident described on page seven of a December 4 complaint and any observations of Epstein engaged in sexual activity.
The email chain shows careful coordination and urgency from prosecutors, who preferred to have the discussion pre-charge while issues were 'very fresh in everyone's minds'.
The defense attorney (M.) was out of the country in early January, causing some scheduling delays, but a meeting was finalized for January 24, 2020.
